}

% *****************************************************************
% siunitx
% *****************************************************************
\newcommand{\sym}[1]{\rlap{#1}} % Thanks to Joseph Wright & David Carlisle

\usepackage{siunitx}
    \sisetup{
        detect-mode,
        group-digits            = false,
        input-symbols           = ( ) [ ] - +,
        tight-spacing		= true,
        table-align-text-post   = false,
        input-signs             = ,
        }   

% Packages for tables
\usepackage{booktabs}% Pretty tables
\usepackage{threeparttablex}% For Notes below table

% Character substitution that prints brackets and the minus symbol in text mode. Thanks to David Carlisle
\def\yyy{%
  \bgroup\uccode`\~\expandafter`\string-%
  \uppercase{\egroup\edef~{\noexpand\text{\llap{\textendash}\relax}}}%
  \mathcode\expandafter`\string-"8000 }

\def\xxxl#1{%
\bgroup\uccode`\~\expandafter`\string#1%
\uppercase{\egroup\edef~{\noexpand\text{\noexpand\llap{\string#1}}}}%
\mathcode\expandafter`\string#1"8000 }

\def\xxxr#1{%
\bgroup\uccode`\~\expandafter`\string#1%
\uppercase{\egroup\edef~{\noexpand\text{\noexpand\rlap{\string#1}}}}%
\mathcode\expandafter`\string#1"8000 }

\def\textsymbols{\xxxl[\xxxr]\xxxl(\xxxr)\yyy}


% *****************************************************************
% Estout related things
% *****************************************************************
\let\estinput=\input % define a new input command so that we can still flatten the document

\newcommand{\estwide}[3]{
        \vspace{.75ex}{
            \textsymbols% Note the added command here
            \begin{tabular*}
            {\textwidth}{@{\hskip\tabcolsep\extracolsep\fill}l*{#2}{#3}}
            \toprule
            \estinput{#1}
            \bottomrule
            \addlinespace[.75ex]
            \end{tabular*}
            }
        }   

\newcommand{\estauto}[3]{
        \vspace{.75ex}{
            \textsymbols% Note the added command here
            \begin{tabular}{l*{#2}{#3}}
            \toprule
            \estinput{#1}
            \bottomrule
            \addlinespace[.75ex]
            \end{tabular}
            }
        }

% *****************************************************************
% Custom subcaptions
% *****************************************************************
% Note/Source/Text after Tables
% The new approach using threeparttables to generate notes that are the exact width of the table.
\newcommand{\Figtext}[1]{%
    \begin{tablenotes}[para,flushleft]
    \hspace{6pt}
    \hangindent=1.75em
    #1
    \end{tablenotes}
    }
\newcommand{\Fignote}[1]{\Figtext{\emph{Note:~}~#1}}
\newcommand{\Figsource}[1]{\Figtext{\emph{Source:~}~#1}}
\newcommand{\Starnote}{\Figtext{* p < 0.1, ** p < 0.05, *** p < 0.01. Standard errors in parentheses.}}% Add significance note with \starnote

% To adjust margins: 
\usepackage{changepage}

\usepackage{bbm}
\usepackage{bm}

\makeatother

\begin{document}
\begin{tabular}{>{\raggedright}p{6cm}>{\raggedright}p{6cm}>{\raggedright}p{5cm}}
\hline 
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Pre-analysis Plan } & {\footnotesize{}Modification} & {\footnotesize{}Location}\tabularnewline
\hline 
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Outcome variables:} &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}\enskip{}Total assets} & {\footnotesize{}Include roof values (forgot to include in PAP) and
omit land values (badly measured)} & {\footnotesize{}Main paper Tables I--II}\tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}\enskip{}Non-durable expenditures} & {\footnotesize{}Omit durable spending and spending on home repair
(creates a better measure of flow consumption)} & {\footnotesize{}Main paper Tables I--II}\tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}\enskip{}Female empowerment (index)} & {\footnotesize{}Replace dummies for whether violent incident was reported
with variables for the number of types of incidents reported (more
sensitive measure)} & {\footnotesize{}Main paper Tables I--II}\tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}\enskip{}Financial variables} & {\footnotesize{}Omit value of outstanding loans and inability to pay
loans (not relevant for remittance results)} & {\footnotesize{}OA Table 34}\tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}\enskip{}Preference \& political variables} & {\footnotesize{}Omit for space reasons} & {\footnotesize{}Omitted}\tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}\enskip{}Village-level price index} & {\footnotesize{}Substitute a weighted average of all individual prices
for a sum} & {\footnotesize{}OA Table 151}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Within-village treatment effect estimation (PAP equations
3--6)} & {\footnotesize{}In addition to conditioning on baseline outcomes,
we include a missing-value indicator variable} & {\footnotesize{}Main paper equations 5--8}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Heterogenous treatment effects effects (PAP equations
8--12)} & {\footnotesize{}Omit for space reasons} & {\footnotesize{}Omitted}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Temporal dynamics: early transfers vs. late transfers
(PAP equations 13--17)} & {\footnotesize{}Omit for space reasons} & {\footnotesize{}Omitted}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Temporal Dynamics: treatment effects broken out for
transfers completed >1 month, 1-3 months, 4-6 months, and 6-12 months
before endline (PAP equation 18).} & {\footnotesize{}Changed timing buckets to <1 month, 1-4 months, and
>4 months before endline (correction of PAP typo and increase of power
at long time horizons)} & {\footnotesize{}OA Table 20 and Figure 4}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Endline timing: create separate treatment dummies
based on the date of the endline survey (PAP section 5.5)} & {\footnotesize{}Replaced this analysis with the original treatment
effect calculation with controls for endline timing} & {\footnotesize{}OA Tables 16--19}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Midline treatment effects} & {\footnotesize{}Omitted for space reasons} & {\footnotesize{}Omitted}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
{\footnotesize{}Village-level general equilibrium effects (PAP equation
20)} & {\footnotesize{}Instead of regressing at the individual level, we
collapse to the village level} & {\footnotesize{}OA Tables 151--161}\tabularnewline
 &  & \tabularnewline
\hline 
\end{tabular}
\end{document}
